member.name: MSLLHOOKSTRUCT
member.summary: Contains information about a low-level mouse input event.

member.name: MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.pt
member.summary: The x- and y-coordinates of the cursor, in screen coordinates.

summary.para: If the message is WM_MOUSEWHEEL, the high-order word of this member is the wheel delta. The low-order word is reserved. A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. One wheel click is defined as WHEEL_DELTA, which is 120.

If the message is WM_XBUTTONDOWN, WM_XBUTTONUP, WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK, WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN, WM_NCXBUTTONUP, or WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK, the high-order word specifies which X button was pressed or released, and the low-order word is reserved. This value can be one or more of the following values. Otherwise,mouseData is not used.

listheader.description: The first X button was pressed or released.
The second X button was pressed or released.

summary.para: The event-injected flags. An application can use the following values to test the flags. Testing LLMHF_INJECTED (bit 0) will tell you whether the event was injected. If it was, then testing LLMHF_LOWER_IL_INJECTED (bit 1) will tell you whether or not the event was injected from a process running at lower integrity level.

listheader.description: Test the event-injected (from any process) flag.
Test the event-injected (from a process running at lower integrity level) flag.

member.name: MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.time
member.summary: The time stamp for this message.

member.name: MSLLHOOKSTRUCT.dwExtraInfo
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.
